titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Frederica de Laguna (1906-2004) was an American ethnologist and archaeologist known for her pioneering work in Northwest North America. She was the first child of two distinguished philosophers, Theodore and Grace Andrus de Laguna, both of whom taught at Bryn Mawr College. Her younger brother, Wallace, was a geologist. She graduated from Bryn Mawr in 1927. She founded the Bryn Mawr College Anthropology Department and taught anthropology at the college from 1938 until her retirement in 1975.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers and photographs kept by Frederica de Laguna. The papers include notes, plates, articles, and transcriptions of songs relating to de Laguna's book Under Mt. St. Elias on the Tlingits in the Yakutat region of Alaska. The collection includes a manuscript of the book. Also included are notes, photographs, maps, reports and correspondence related to the Bryn Mawr College 1941 excavations at Cinder Park, Arizona.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: National Anthropological Archives, Smithsonian Institution: Frederica de Laguna papers.
